        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        my chromium commit is <span class="line"><!---->my chromium commit is <!----></span>5731686672a2e8751f409a960da886f10849433b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/5731686672a2e8751f409a960da886f10849433b"><!---->5731686672a2e8751f409a960da886f10849433b<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I think that what happened here conceptually is:<span class="line"><!---->I think that what happened here conceptually is:<!----></span><br><br>1. The CrOS share sheet dismisses & destroys itself when it observes the browser window is about to close (or by some other path)<span class="line"><!---->1. The CrOS share sheet dismisses &amp; destroys itself when it observes the browser window is about to close (or by some other path)<!----></span><br>2. The SharingHubBubbleController doesn't know the CrOS share sheet has dismissed itself and tries to close it during a later stage of window teardown<span class="line"><!---->2. The SharingHubBubbleController doesn't know the CrOS share sheet has dismissed itself and tries to close it during a later stage of window teardown<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Ok - I believe this is a bug in the CrOS sharesheet, not in our code. Specifically, I think the bug is here:<span class="line"><!---->Ok - I believe this is a bug in the CrOS sharesheet, not in our code. Specifically, I think the bug is here:<!----></span><br><br>  void SharesheetBubbleView::CloseWidgetWithReason(<span class="line"><!---->  void SharesheetBubbleView::CloseWidgetWithReason(<!----></span><br>      views::Widget::ClosedReason closed_reason) {<span class="line"><!---->      views::Widget::ClosedReason closed_reason) {<!----></span><br>    View::GetWidget()->CloseWithReason(closed_reason);<span class="line"><!---->    View::GetWidget()-&gt;CloseWithReason(closed_reason);<!----></span><br><br>    // Run |close_callback_| after the widget closes.<span class="line"><!---->    // Run |close_callback_| after the widget closes.<!----></span><br>    if (close_callback_) {<span class="line"><!---->    if (close_callback_) {<!----></span><br>      std::move(close_callback_).Run(closed_reason);<span class="line"><!---->      std::move(close_callback_).Run(closed_reason);<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>    // Bubble is deleted here.<span class="line"><!---->    // Bubble is deleted here.<!----></span><br>    delegate_->OnBubbleClosed(active_target_);<span class="line"><!---->    delegate_-&gt;OnBubbleClosed(active_target_);<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>That's how the `closed_callback_` gets run, but if the ash sharesheet is closed via teardown of the widget tree itself, that code will never be run - instead what will happen is that the ShareSheetBubbleView gets torn down "directly". I think that the best way to fix that is for the destructor of ShareSheetBubbleView to check if close_callback_ is not null and run it if so, to ensure that the client object of ShareSheetBubbleView is always notified.<span class="line"><!---->That's how the `closed_callback_` gets run, but if the ash sharesheet is closed via teardown of the widget tree itself, that code will never be run - instead what will happen is that the ShareSheetBubbleView gets torn down "directly". I think that the best way to fix that is for the destructor of ShareSheetBubbleView to check if close_callback_ is not null and run it if so, to ensure that the client object of ShareSheetBubbleView is always notified.<!----></span><br><br>I'll send a CL to fix it.<span class="line"><!---->I'll send a CL to fix it.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        It sounds like the repro steps in #13 were:<span class="line"><!---->It sounds like the repro steps in #13 were:<!----></span><br><br>1. In window 1, create tabs 1A & 1B<span class="line"><!---->1. In window 1, create tabs 1A &amp; 1B<!----></span><br>2. Open the sharing hub with tab 1B active<span class="line"><!---->2. Open the sharing hub with tab 1B active<!----></span><br>3. Switch to window 2, which causes the sharing hub in window 1 to dismiss<span class="line"><!---->3. Switch to window 2, which causes the sharing hub in window 1 to dismiss<!----></span><br>4. Switch back to window 1 and close tab 1B<span class="line"><!---->4.         There's something kind of suspect here, but I haven't yet figured out exactly what it is. I know that:<span class="line"><!---->There's something kind of suspect here, but I haven't yet figured out exactly what it is. I know that:<!----></span><br><br>* aura::Window::~Window() will synthesize a focus-loss event for the window<span class="line"><!---->* aura::Window::~Window() will synthesize a focus-loss event for the window<!----></span><br>* SharesheetBubbleView handles that loss of focus by starting an animated fadeout of the sharesheet (SharesheetBubbleView::CloseWidgetWithAnimateFadeOut)<span class="line"><!---->* SharesheetBubbleView handles that loss of focus by starting an animated fadeout of the sharesheet (SharesheetBubbleView::CloseWidgetWithAnimateFadeOut)<!----></span><br>* SharingHubBubbleController::~SharingHubBubbleController tries to call SharesheetBubbleViewDelegate::CloseBubble, which calls SharesheetBubbleView::CloseBubble()<span class="line"><!---->* SharingHubBubbleController::~SharingHubBubbleController tries to call SharesheetBubbleViewDelegate::CloseBubble, which calls SharesheetBubbleView::CloseBubble()<!----></span><br><br>There's this puzzling comment at the bottom of SharesheetBubbleView::CloseWidgetWithAnimateFadeOut():<span class="line"><!---->There's this puzzling comment at the bottom of SharesheetBubbleView::CloseWidgetWithAnimateFadeOut():<!----></span><br><br>  // We are closing the native widget during the close animation which results<span class="line"><!---->  // We are closing the native widget during the close animation which results<!----></span><br>  // in destroying the layer and the animation and the observer not calling<span class="line"><!---->  // in destroying the layer and the animation and the observer not calling<!----></span><br>  // back. Thus it is safe to use base::Unretained here.<span class="line"><!---->  // back. Thus it is safe to use base::Unretained here.<!----></span><br>  scoped_settings->AddObserver(new ui::ClosureAnimationObserver(<span class="line"><!---->  scoped_settings-&gt;AddObserver(new ui::ClosureAnimationObserver(<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(&SharesheetBubbleView::CloseWidgetWithReason,<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(&amp;SharesheetBubbleView::CloseWidgetWithReason,<!----></span><br>                     base::Unretained(this), closed_reason)));<span class="line"><!---->                     base::Unretained(this), closed_reason)));<!----></span><br><br>I think that *if*:<span class="line"><!---->I think that *if*:<!----></span><br><br>1. The SharesheetBubbleView's widget has lost focus as part of its own destruction<span class="line"><!---->1. The SharesheetBubbleView's widget has lost focus as part of its own destruction<!----></span><br>2. That results in SharesheetBubbleView::CloseWidgetWithAnimateFadeOut<span class="line"><!---->2. That results in SharesheetBubbleView::CloseWidgetWithAnimateFadeOut<!----></span><br>3. While that animation is waiting to complete, SharesheetBubbleView's widget finishes destroying (destroying SharesheetBubbleView itself), and teardown of the parent tab starts<span class="line"><!---->3. While that animation is waiting to complete, SharesheetBubbleView's widget finishes destroying (destroying SharesheetBubbleView itself), and teardown of the parent tab starts<!----></span><br>4. Teardown of the parent tab causes unloading of its WebContents, causing destruction of SharingHubBubbleController<span class="line"><!---->4. Teardown of the parent tab causes unloading of its WebContents, causing destruction of SharingHubBubbleController<!----></span><br>5. Destruction of SharingHubBubbleController causes a reference to the now-destroyed SharesheetBubbleView<span class="line"><!---->5. Destruction of SharingHubBubbleController causes a reference to the now-destroyed SharesheetBubbleView<!----></span><br><br>Since the animation from step (3) didn't complete yet, the close callback for SharesheetBubbleView was never run, so SharingHubBubbleController has no idea the SharesheetBubbleView is gone.<span class="line"><!---->Since the animation from step (3) didn't complete yet, the close callback for SharesheetBubbleView was never run, so SharingHubBubbleController has no idea the SharesheetBubbleView is gone.<!----></span><br><br>The main question here is what the behavior of the animation created in CloseWidgetWithAnimateFadeOut is when the widget is destroyed. It appears that LayerAnimator *doesn't* notify LayerAnimationObservers:<span class="line"><!---->The main question here is what the behavior of the animation created in CloseWidgetWithAnimateFadeOut is when the widget is destroyed. It appears that LayerAnimator *doesn't* notify LayerAnimationObservers:<!----></span><br><br>  void LayerAnimationSequence::OnAnimatorDestroyed() {<span class="line"><!---->  void LayerAnimationSequence::OnAnimatorDestroyed() {<!----></span><br>    for (LayerAnimationObserver& observer : observers_) {<span class="line"><!---->    for (LayerAnimationObserver&amp; observer : observers_) {<!----></span><br>      if (!observer.RequiresNotificationWhenAnimatorDestroyed()) {<span class="line"><!---->      if (!observer.RequiresNotificationWhenAnimatorDestroyed()) {<!----></span><br>        // Remove the observer, but do not allow notifications to be sent.<span class="line"><!---->        // Remove the observer, but do not allow notifications to be sent.<!----></span><br>        observers_.RemoveObserver(&observer);<span class="line"><!---->        observers_.RemoveObserver(&amp;observer);<!----></span><br>        observer.DetachedFromSequence(this, false);<span class="line"><!---->        observer.DetachedFromSequence(this, false);<!----></span><br>      }<span class="line"><!---->      }<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>... but some of these classes are refcounted, so it's hard to know what the lifetimes are.<span class="line"><!---->... but some of these classes are refcounted, so it's hard to know what the lifetimes are.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>

          Comment 32<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1249491#c32">Comment 32<!----></a>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.     <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>
      <mr-description></mr-description>
      <mr-comment-list headinglevel="2"></mr-comment-list>
      
    <!----></mr-issue-details>
              
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;
          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      <style>
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;
          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      </style>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        <div class="target-project-dialog">
          <h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        my chromium commit is <span class="line"><!---->my chromium commit is <!----></span>5731686672a2e8751f409a960da886f10849433b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/5731686672a2e8751f409a960da886f10849433b"><!---->5731686672a2e8751f409a960da886f10849433b<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I think that what happened here conceptually is:<span class="line"><!---->I think that what happened here conceptually is:<!----></span><br><br>1. The CrOS share sheet dismisses & destroys itself when it observes the browser window is about to close (or by some other path)<span class="line"><!---->1. The CrOS share sheet dismisses &amp; destroys itself when it observes the browser window is about to close (or by some other path)<!----></span><br>2. The SharingHubBubbleController doesn't know the CrOS share sheet has dismissed itself and tries to close it during a later stage of window teardown<span class="line"><!---->2. The SharingHubBubbleController doesn't know the CrOS share sheet has dismissed itself and tries to close it during a later stage of window teardown<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Ok - I believe this is a bug in the CrOS sharesheet, not in our code. Specifically, I think the bug is here:<span class="line"><!---->Ok - I believe this is a bug in the CrOS sharesheet, not in our code. Specifically, I think the bug is here:<!----></span><br><br>  void SharesheetBubbleView::CloseWidgetWithReason(<span class="line"><!---->  void SharesheetBubbleView::CloseWidgetWithReason(<!----></span><br>      views::Widget::ClosedReason closed_reason) {<span class="line"><!---->      views::Widget::ClosedReason closed_reason) {<!----></span><br>    View::GetWidget()->CloseWithReason(closed_reason);<span class="line"><!---->    View::GetWidget()-&gt;CloseWithReason(closed_reason);<!----></span><br><br>    // Run |close_callback_| after the widget closes.<span class="line"><!---->    // Run |close_callback_| after the widget closes.<!----></span><br>    if (close_callback_) {<span class="line"><!---->    if (close_callback_) {<!----></span><br>      std::move(close_callback_).Run(closed_reason);<span class="line"><!---->      std::move(close_callback_).Run(closed_reason);<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>    // Bubble is deleted here.<span class="line"><!---->    // Bubble is deleted here.<!----></span><br>    delegate_->OnBubbleClosed(active_target_);<span class="line"><!---->    delegate_-&gt;OnBubbleClosed(active_target_);<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>That's how the `closed_callback_` gets run, but if the ash sharesheet is closed via teardown of the widget tree itself, that code will never be run - instead what will happen is that the ShareSheetBubbleView gets torn down "directly". I think that the best way to fix that is for the destructor of ShareSheetBubbleView to check if close_callback_ is not null and run it if so, to ensure that the client object of ShareSheetBubbleView is always notified.<span class="line"><!---->That's how the `closed_callback_` gets run, but if the ash sharesheet is closed via teardown of the widget tree itself, that code will never be run - instead what will happen is that the ShareSheetBubbleView gets torn down "directly". I think that the best way to fix that is for the destructor of ShareSheetBubbleView to check if close_callback_ is not null and run it if so, to ensure that the client object of ShareSheetBubbleView is always notified.<!----></span><br><br>I'll send a CL to fix it.<span class="line"><!---->I'll send a CL to fix it.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        It sounds like the repro steps in #13 were:<span class="line"><!---->It sounds like the repro steps in #13 were:<!----></span><br><br>1. In window 1, create tabs 1A & 1B<span class="line"><!---->1. In window 1, create tabs 1A &amp; 1B<!----></span><br>2. Open the sharing hub with tab 1B active<span class="line"><!---->2. Open the sharing hub with tab 1B active<!----></span><br>3. Switch to window 2, which causes the sharing hub in window 1 to dismiss<span class="line"><!---->3. Switch to window 2, which causes the sharing hub in window 1 to dismiss<!----></span><br>4. Switch back to window 1 and close tab 1B<span class="line"><!---->4.         There's something kind of suspect here, but I haven't yet figured out exactly what it is. I know that:<span class="line"><!---->There's something kind of suspect here, but I haven't yet figured out exactly what it is. I know that:<!----></span><br><br>* aura::Window::~Window() will synthesize a focus-loss event for the window<span class="line"><!---->* aura::Window::~Window() will synthesize a focus-loss event for the window<!----></span><br>* SharesheetBubbleView handles that loss of focus by starting an animated fadeout of the sharesheet (SharesheetBubbleView::CloseWidgetWithAnimateFadeOut)<span class="line"><!---->* SharesheetBubbleView handles that loss of focus by starting an animated fadeout of the sharesheet (SharesheetBubbleView::CloseWidgetWithAnimateFadeOut)<!----></span><br>* SharingHubBubbleController::~SharingHubBubbleController tries to call SharesheetBubbleViewDelegate::CloseBubble, which calls SharesheetBubbleView::CloseBubble()<span class="line"><!---->* SharingHubBubbleController::~SharingHubBubbleController tries to call SharesheetBubbleViewDelegate::CloseBubble, which calls SharesheetBubbleView::CloseBubble()<!----></span><br><br>There's this puzzling comment at the bottom of SharesheetBubbleView::CloseWidgetWithAnimateFadeOut():<span class="line"><!---->There's this puzzling comment at the bottom of SharesheetBubbleView::CloseWidgetWithAnimateFadeOut():<!----></span><br><br>  // We are closing the native widget during the close animation which results<span class="line"><!---->  // We are closing the native widget during the close animation which results<!----></span><br>  // in destroying the layer and the animation and the observer not calling<span class="line"><!---->  // in destroying the layer and the animation and the observer not calling<!----></span><br>  // back. Thus it is safe to use base::Unretained here.<span class="line"><!---->  // back. Thus it is safe to use base::Unretained here.<!----></span><br>  scoped_settings->AddObserver(new ui::ClosureAnimationObserver(<span class="line"><!---->  scoped_settings-&gt;AddObserver(new ui::ClosureAnimationObserver(<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(&SharesheetBubbleView::CloseWidgetWithReason,<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(&amp;SharesheetBubbleView::CloseWidgetWithReason,<!----></span><br>                     base::Unretained(this), closed_reason)));<span class="line"><!---->                     base::Unretained(this), closed_reason)));<!----></span><br><br>I think that *if*:<span class="line"><!---->I think that *if*:<!----></span><br><br>1. The SharesheetBubbleView's widget has lost focus as part of its own destruction<span class="line"><!---->1. The SharesheetBubbleView's widget has lost focus as part of its own destruction<!----></span><br>2. That results in SharesheetBubbleView::CloseWidgetWithAnimateFadeOut<span class="line"><!---->2. That results in SharesheetBubbleView::CloseWidgetWithAnimateFadeOut<!----></span><br>3. While that animation is waiting to complete, SharesheetBubbleView's widget finishes destroying (destroying SharesheetBubbleView itself), and teardown of the parent tab starts<span class="line"><!---->3. While that animation is waiting to complete, SharesheetBubbleView's widget finishes destroying (destroying SharesheetBubbleView itself), and teardown of the parent tab starts<!----></span><br>4. Teardown of the parent tab causes unloading of its WebContents, causing destruction of SharingHubBubbleController<span class="line"><!---->4. Teardown of the parent tab causes unloading of its WebContents, causing destruction of SharingHubBubbleController<!----></span><br>5. Destruction of SharingHubBubbleController causes a reference to the now-destroyed SharesheetBubbleView<span class="line"><!---->5. Destruction of SharingHubBubbleController causes a reference to the now-destroyed SharesheetBubbleView<!----></span><br><br>Since the animation from step (3) didn't complete yet, the close callback for SharesheetBubbleView was never run, so SharingHubBubbleController has no idea the SharesheetBubbleView is gone.<span class="line"><!---->Since the animation from step (3) didn't complete yet, the close callback for SharesheetBubbleView was never run, so SharingHubBubbleController has no idea the SharesheetBubbleView is gone.<!----></span><br><br>The main question here is what the behavior of the animation created in CloseWidgetWithAnimateFadeOut is when the widget is destroyed. It appears that LayerAnimator *doesn't* notify LayerAnimationObservers:<span class="line"><!---->The main question here is what the behavior of the animation created in CloseWidgetWithAnimateFadeOut is when the widget is destroyed. It appears that LayerAnimator *doesn't* notify LayerAnimationObservers:<!----></span><br><br>  void LayerAnimationSequence::OnAnimatorDestroyed() {<span class="line"><!---->  void LayerAnimationSequence::OnAnimatorDestroyed() {<!----></span><br>    for (LayerAnimationObserver& observer : observers_) {<span class="line"><!---->    for (LayerAnimationObserver&amp; observer : observers_) {<!----></span><br>      if (!observer.RequiresNotificationWhenAnimatorDestroyed()) {<span class="line"><!---->      if (!observer.RequiresNotificationWhenAnimatorDestroyed()) {<!----></span><br>        // Remove the observer, but do not allow notifications to be sent.<span class="line"><!---->        // Remove the observer, but do not allow notifications to be sent.<!----></span><br>        observers_.RemoveObserver(&observer);<span class="line"><!---->        observers_.RemoveObserver(&amp;observer);<!----></span><br>        observer.DetachedFromSequence(this, false);<span class="line"><!---->        observer.DetachedFromSequence(this, false);<!----></span><br>      }<span class="line"><!---->      }<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>... but some of these classes are refcounted, so it's hard to know what the lifetimes are.<span class="line"><!---->... but some of these classes are refcounted, so it's hard to know what the lifetimes are.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>

          Comment 32<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1249491#c32">Comment 32<!----></a>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.     <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>
      <mr-description></mr-description>
      <mr-comment-list headinglevel="2"></mr-comment-list>
      
    <!----></mr-issue-details>
              
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;
          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      <style>
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;
          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      </style>

        mr-issue-details {

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1249491#c20">Comment 20<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Oct 6, 2021, 2:01 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        I think that what happened here conceptually is:<span class="line"><!---->I think that what happened here conceptually is:<!----></span><br><br>1. The CrOS share sheet dismisses & destroys itself when it observes the browser window is about to close (or by some other path)<span class="line"><!---->1. The CrOS share sheet dismisses &amp; destroys itself when it observes the browser window is about to close (or by some other path)<!----></span><br>2. The SharingHubBubbleController doesn't know the CrOS share sheet has dismissed itself and tries to close it during a later stage of window teardown<span class="line"><!---->2. The SharingHubBubbleController doesn't know the CrOS share sheet has dismissed itself and tries to close it during a later stage of window teardown<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2"></mr-comment>
      
      
      
        
          Comment 21<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1249491#c21">Comment 21<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      ellyj...@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/2621302795" title="ellyj...@chromium.org"><!---->ellyj...@chromium.org<!----></a>
      ellyj...@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->ellyj...@chromium.org<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Wed, Oct 6, 2021, 4:32 PM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Oct 6, 2021, 4:32 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1249491#c21">Comment 21<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Oct 6, 2021, 4:32 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1249491#c21">Comment 21<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Oct 6, 2021, 4:32 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        Ok - I believe this is a bug in the CrOS sharesheet, not in our code. Specifically, I think the bug is here:<span class="line"><!---->Ok - I believe this is a bug in the CrOS sharesheet, not in our code. Specifically, I think the bug is here:<!----></span><br><br>  void SharesheetBubbleView::CloseWidgetWithReason(<span class="line"><!---->  void SharesheetBubbleView::CloseWidgetWithReason(<!----></span><br>      views::Widget::ClosedReason closed_reason) {<span class="line"><!---->      views::Widget::ClosedReason closed_reason) {<!----></span><br>    View::GetWidget()->CloseWithReason(closed_reason);<span class="line"><!---->    View::GetWidget()-&gt;CloseWithReason(closed_reason);<!----></span><br><br>    // Run |close_callback_| after the widget closes.<span class="line"><!---->    // Run |close_callback_| after the widget closes.<!----></span><br>    if (close_callback_) {<span class="line"><!---->    if (close_callback_) {<!----></span><br>      std::move(close_callback_).Run(closed_reason);<span class="line"><!---->      std::move(close_callback_).Run(closed_reason);<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>    // Bubble is deleted here.<span class="line"><!---->    // Bubble is deleted here.<!----></span><br>    delegate_->OnBubbleClosed(active_target_);<span class="line"><!---->    delegate_-&gt;OnBubbleClosed(active_target_);<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>That's how the `closed_callback_` gets run, but if the ash sharesheet is closed via teardown of the widget tree itself, that code will never be run - instead what will happen is that the ShareSheetBubbleView gets torn down "directly". I think that the best way to fix that is for the destructor of ShareSheetBubbleView to check if close_callback_ is not null and run it if so, to ensure that the client object of ShareSheetBubbleView is always notified.<span class="line"><!---->That's how the `closed_callback_` gets run, but if the ash sharesheet is closed via teardown of the widget tree itself, that code will never be run - instead what will happen is that the ShareSheetBubbleView gets torn down "directly". I think that the best way to fix that is for the destructor of ShareSheetBubbleView to check if close_callback_ is not null and run it if so, to ensure that the client object of ShareSheetBubbleView is always notified.<!----></span><br><br>I'll send a CL to fix it.<span class="line"><!---->I'll send a CL to fix it.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        It sounds like the repro steps in #13 were:<span class="line"><!---->It sounds like the repro steps in #13 were:<!----></span><br><br>1. In window 1, create tabs 1A & 1B<span class="line"><!---->1. In window 1, create tabs 1A &amp; 1B<!----></span><br>2. Open the sharing hub with tab 1B active<span class="line"><!---->2. Open the sharing hub with tab 1B active<!----></span><br>3. Switch to window 2, which causes the sharing hub in window 1 to dismiss<span class="line"><!---->3. Switch to window 2, which causes the sharing hub in window 1 to dismiss<!----></span><br>4. Switch back to window 1 and close tab 1B<span class="line"><!---->4. Switch back to window 1 and close tab 1B<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        There's something kind of suspect here, but I haven't yet figured out exactly what it is. I know that:<span class="line"><!---->There's something kind of suspect here, but I haven't yet figured out exactly what it is. I know that:<!----></span><br><br>* aura::Window::~Window() will synthesize a focus-loss event for the window<span class="line"><!---->* aura::Window::~Window() will synthesize a focus-loss event for the window<!----></span><br>* SharesheetBubbleView handles that loss of focus by starting an animated fadeout of the sharesheet (SharesheetBubbleView::CloseWidgetWithAnimateFadeOut)<span class="line"><!---->* SharesheetBubbleView handles that loss of focus by starting an animated fadeout of the sharesheet (SharesheetBubbleView::CloseWidgetWithAnimateFadeOut)<!----></span><br>* SharingHubBubbleController::~SharingHubBubbleController tries to call SharesheetBubbleViewDelegate::CloseBubble, which calls SharesheetBubbleView::CloseBubble()<span class="line"><!---->* SharingHubBubbleController::~SharingHubBubbleController tries to call SharesheetBubbleViewDelegate::CloseBubble, which calls SharesheetBubbleView::CloseBubble()<!----></span><br><br>There's this puzzling comment at the bottom of SharesheetBubbleView::CloseWidgetWithAnimateFadeOut():<span class="line"><!---->There's this puzzling comment at the bottom of SharesheetBubbleView::CloseWidgetWithAnimateFadeOut():<!----></span><br><br>  // We are closing the native widget during the close animation which results<span class="line"><!---->  // We are closing the native widget during the close animation which results<!----></span><br>  // in destroying the layer and the animation and the observer not calling<span class="line"><!---->  // in destroying the layer and the animation and the observer not calling<!----></span><br>  // back. Thus it is safe to use base::Unretained here.<span class="line"><!---->  // back. Thus it is safe to use base::Unretained here.<!----></span><br>  scoped_settings->AddObserver(new ui::ClosureAnimationObserver(<span class="line"><!---->  scoped_settings-&gt;AddObserver(new ui::ClosureAnimationObserver(<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(&SharesheetBubbleView::CloseWidgetWithReason,<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(&amp;SharesheetBubbleView::CloseWidgetWithReason,<!----></span><br>                     base::Unretained(this), closed_reason)));<span class="line"><!---->                     base::Unretained(this), closed_reason)));<!----></span><br><br>I think that *if*:<span class="line"><!---->I think that *if*:<!----></span><br><br>1. The SharesheetBubbleView's widget has lost focus as part of its own destruction<span class="line"><!---->1. The SharesheetBubbleView's widget has lost focus as part of its own destruction<!----></span><br>2. That results in SharesheetBubbleView::CloseWidgetWithAnimateFadeOut<span class="line"><!---->2. That results in SharesheetBubbleView::CloseWidgetWithAnimateFadeOut<!----></span><br>3. While that animation is waiting to complete, SharesheetBubbleView's widget finishes destroying (destroying SharesheetBubbleView itself), and teardown of the parent tab starts<span class="line"><!---->3. While that animation is waiting to complete, SharesheetBubbleView's widget finishes destroying (destroying SharesheetBubbleView itself), and teardown of the parent tab starts<!----></span><br>4. Teardown of the parent tab causes unloading of its WebContents, causing destruction of SharingHubBubbleController<span class="line"><!---->4. Teardown of the parent tab causes unloading of its WebContents, causing destruction of SharingHubBubbleController<!----></span><br>5. Destruction of SharingHubBubbleController causes a reference to the now-destroyed SharesheetBubbleView<span class="line"><!---->5. Destruction of SharingHubBubbleController causes a reference to the now-destroyed SharesheetBubbleView<!----></span><br><br>Since the animation from step (3) didn't complete yet, the close callback for SharesheetBubbleView was never run, so SharingHubBubbleController has no idea the SharesheetBubbleView is gone.<span class="line"><!---->Since the animation from step (3) didn't complete yet, the close callback for SharesheetBubbleView was never run, so SharingHubBubbleController has no idea the SharesheetBubbleView is gone.<!----></span><br><br>The main question here is what the behavior of the animation created in CloseWidgetWithAnimateFadeOut is when the widget is destroyed. It appears that LayerAnimator *doesn't* notify LayerAnimationObservers:<span class="line"><!---->The main question here is what the behavior of the animation created in CloseWidgetWithAnimateFadeOut is when the widget is destroyed. It appears that LayerAnimator *doesn't* notify LayerAnimationObservers:<!----></span><br><br>  void LayerAnimationSequence::OnAnimatorDestroyed() {<span class="line"><!---->  void LayerAnimationSequence::OnAnimatorDestroyed() {<!----></span><br>    for (LayerAnimationObserver& observer : observers_) {<span class="line"><!---->    for (LayerAnimationObserver&amp; observer : observers_) {<!----></span><br>      if (!observer.RequiresNotificationWhenAnimatorDestroyed()) {<span class="line"><!---->      if (!observer.RequiresNotificationWhenAnimatorDestroyed()) {<!----></span><br>        // Remove the observer, but do not allow notifications to be sent.<span class="line"><!---->        // Remove the observer, but do not allow notifications to be sent.<!----></span><br>        observers_.RemoveObserver(&observer);<span class="line"><!---->        observers_.RemoveObserver(&amp;observer);<!----></span><br>        observer.DetachedFromSequence(this, false);<span class="line"><!---->        observer.DetachedFromSequence(this, false);<!----></span><br>      }<span class="line"><!---->      }<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>... but some of these classes are refcounted, so it's hard to know what the lifetimes are.<span class="line"><!---->... but some of these classes are refcounted, so it's hard to know what the lifetimes are.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 36<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1249491#c36">Comment 36<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        I think that what happened here conceptually is:<span class="line"><!---->I think that what happened here conceptually is:<!----></span><br><br>1. The CrOS share sheet dismisses & destroys itself when it observes the browser window is about to close (or by some other path)<span class="line"><!---->1. The CrOS share sheet dismisses &amp; destroys itself when it observes the browser window is about to close (or by some other path)<!----></span><br>2. The SharingHubBubbleController doesn't know the CrOS share sheet has dismissed itself and tries to close it during a later stage of window teardown<span class="line"><!---->2. The SharingHubBubbleController doesn't know the CrOS share sheet has dismissed itself and tries to close it during a later stage of window teardown<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

        Ok - I believe this is a bug in the CrOS sharesheet, not in our code. Specifically, I think the bug is here:<span class="line"><!---->Ok - I believe this is a bug in the CrOS sharesheet, not in our code. Specifically, I think the bug is here:<!----></span><br><br>  void SharesheetBubbleView::CloseWidgetWithReason(<span class="line"><!---->  void SharesheetBubbleView::CloseWidgetWithReason(<!----></span><br>      views::Widget::ClosedReason closed_reason) {<span class="line"><!---->      views::Widget::ClosedReason closed_reason) {<!----></span><br>    View::GetWidget()->CloseWithReason(closed_reason);<span class="line"><!---->    View::GetWidget()-&gt;CloseWithReason(closed_reason);<!----></span><br><br>    // Run |close_callback_| after the widget closes.<span class="line"><!---->    // Run |close_callback_| after the widget closes.<!----></span><br>    if (close_callback_) {<span class="line"><!---->    if (close_callback_) {<!----></span><br>      std::move(close_callback_).Run(closed_reason);<span class="line"><!---->      std::move(close_callback_).Run(closed_reason);<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>    // Bubble is deleted here.<span class="line"><!---->    // Bubble is deleted here.<!----></span><br>    delegate_->OnBubbleClosed(active_target_);<span class="line"><!---->    delegate_-&gt;OnBubbleClosed(active_target_);<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>That's how the `closed_callback_` gets run, but if the ash sharesheet is closed via teardown of the widget tree itself, that code will never be run - instead what will happen is that the ShareSheetBubbleView gets torn down "directly". I think that the best way to fix that is for the destructor of ShareSheetBubbleView to check if close_callback_ is not null and run it if so, to ensure that the client object of ShareSheetBubbleView is always notified.<span class="line"><!---->That's how the `closed_callback_` gets run, but if the ash sharesheet is closed via teardown of the widget tree itself, that code will never be run - instead what will happen is that the ShareSheetBubbleView gets torn down "directly". I think that the best way to fix that is for the destructor of ShareSheetBubbleView to check if close_callback_ is not null and run it if so, to ensure that the client object of ShareSheetBubbleView is always notified.<!----></span><br><br>I'll send a CL to fix it.<span class="line"><!---->I'll send a CL to fix it.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

        It sounds like the repro steps in #13 were:<span class="line"><!---->It sounds like the repro steps in #13 were:<!----></span><br><br>1. In window 1, create tabs 1A & 1B<span class="line"><!---->1. In window 1, create tabs 1A &amp; 1B<!----></span><br>2. Open the sharing hub with tab 1B active<span class="line"><!---->2. Open the sharing hub with tab 1B active<!----></span><br>3. Switch to window 2, which causes the sharing hub in window 1 to dismiss<span class="line"><!---->3. Switch to window 2, which causes the sharing hub in window 1 to dismiss<!----></span><br>4. Switch back to window 1 and close tab 1B<span class="line"><!---->4.         by

        There's something kind of suspect here, but I haven't yet figured out exactly what it is. I know that:<span class="line"><!---->There's something kind of suspect here, but I haven't yet figured out exactly what it is. I know that:<!----></span><br><br>* aura::Window::~Window() will synthesize a focus-loss event for the window<span class="line"><!---->* aura::Window::~Window() will synthesize a focus-loss event for the window<!----></span><br>* SharesheetBubbleView handles that loss of focus by starting an animated fadeout of the sharesheet (SharesheetBubbleView::CloseWidgetWithAnimateFadeOut)<span class="line"><!---->* SharesheetBubbleView handles that loss of focus by starting an animated fadeout of the sharesheet (SharesheetBubbleView::CloseWidgetWithAnimateFadeOut)<!----></span><br>* SharingHubBubbleController::~SharingHubBubbleController tries to call SharesheetBubbleViewDelegate::CloseBubble, which calls SharesheetBubbleView::CloseBubble()<span class="line"><!---->* SharingHubBubbleController::~SharingHubBubbleController tries to call SharesheetBubbleViewDelegate::CloseBubble, which calls SharesheetBubbleView::CloseBubble()<!----></span><br><br>There's this puzzling comment at the bottom of SharesheetBubbleView::CloseWidgetWithAnimateFadeOut():<span class="line"><!---->There's this puzzling comment at the bottom of SharesheetBubbleView::CloseWidgetWithAnimateFadeOut():<!----></span><br><br>  // We are closing the native widget during the close animation which results<span class="line"><!---->  // We are closing the native widget during the close animation which results<!----></span><br>  // in destroying the layer and the animation and the observer not calling<span class="line"><!---->  // in destroying the layer and the animation and the observer not calling<!----></span><br>  // back. Thus it is safe to use base::Unretained here.<span class="line"><!---->  // back. Thus it is safe to use base::Unretained here.<!----></span><br>  scoped_settings->AddObserver(new ui::ClosureAnimationObserver(<span class="line"><!---->  scoped_settings-&gt;AddObserver(new ui::ClosureAnimationObserver(<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(&SharesheetBubbleView::CloseWidgetWithReason,<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(&amp;SharesheetBubbleView::CloseWidgetWithReason,<!----></span><br>                     base::Unretained(this), closed_reason)));<span class="line"><!---->                     base::Unretained(this), closed_reason)));<!----></span><br><br>I think that *if*:<span class="line"><!---->I think that *if*:<!----></span><br><br>1. The SharesheetBubbleView's widget has lost focus as part of its own destruction<span class="line"><!---->1. The SharesheetBubbleView's widget has lost focus as part of its own destruction<!----></span><br>2. That results in SharesheetBubbleView::CloseWidgetWithAnimateFadeOut<span class="line"><!---->2. That results in SharesheetBubbleView::CloseWidgetWithAnimateFadeOut<!----></span><br>3. While that animation is waiting to complete, SharesheetBubbleView's widget finishes destroying (destroying SharesheetBubbleView itself), and teardown of the parent tab starts<span class="line"><!---->3. While that animation is waiting to complete, SharesheetBubbleView's widget finishes destroying (destroying SharesheetBubbleView itself), and teardown of the parent tab starts<!----></span><br>4. Teardown of the parent tab causes unloading of its WebContents, causing destruction of SharingHubBubbleController<span class="line"><!---->4. Teardown of the parent tab causes unloading of its WebContents, causing destruction of SharingHubBubbleController<!----></span><br>5. Destruction of SharingHubBubbleController causes a reference to the now-destroyed SharesheetBubbleView<span class="line"><!---->5. Destruction of SharingHubBubbleController causes a reference to the now-destroyed SharesheetBubbleView<!----></span><br><br>Since the animation from step (3) didn't complete yet, the close callback for SharesheetBubbleView was never run, so SharingHubBubbleController has no idea the SharesheetBubbleView is gone.<span class="line"><!---->Since the animation from step (3) didn't complete yet, the close callback for SharesheetBubbleView was never run, so SharingHubBubbleController has no idea the SharesheetBubbleView is gone.<!----></span><br><br>The main question here is what the behavior of the animation created in CloseWidgetWithAnimateFadeOut is when the widget is destroyed. It appears that LayerAnimator *doesn't* notify LayerAnimationObservers:<span class="line"><!---->The main question here is what the behavior of the animation created in CloseWidgetWithAnimateFadeOut is when the widget is destroyed. It appears that LayerAnimator *doesn't* notify LayerAnimationObservers:<!----></span><br><br>  void LayerAnimationSequence::OnAnimatorDestroyed() {<span class="line"><!---->  void LayerAnimationSequence::OnAnimatorDestroyed() {<!----></span><br>    for (LayerAnimationObserver& observer : observers_) {<span class="line"><!---->    for (LayerAnimationObserver&amp; observer : observers_) {<!----></span><br>      if (!observer.RequiresNotificationWhenAnimatorDestroyed()) {<span class="line"><!---->      if (!observer.RequiresNotificationWhenAnimatorDestroyed()) {<!----></span><br>        // Remove the observer, but do not allow notifications to be sent.<span class="line"><!---->        // Remove the observer, but do not allow notifications to be sent.<!----></span><br>        observers_.RemoveObserver(&observer);<span class="line"><!---->        observers_.RemoveObserver(&amp;observer);<!----></span><br>        observer.DetachedFromSequence(this, false);<span class="line"><!---->        observer.DetachedFromSequence(this, false);<!----></span><br>      }<span class="line"><!---->      }<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>... but some of these classes are refcounted, so it's hard to know what the lifetimes are.<span class="line"><!---->... but some of these classes are refcounted, so it's hard to know what the lifetimes are.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

If other changes are required to fix this bug completely, please request a merge if necessary.<span class="line"><!---->Not requesting merge to dev (M96) because latest trunk commit (929499) appears to be prior to dev branch point (929512). If this is incorrect, please replace the Merge-NA-96 label with Merge-Request-96. If other changes are required to fix this bug completely, please request a merge if necessary.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.         I think that what happened here conceptually is:<span class="line"><!---->I think that what happened here conceptually is:<!----></span><br><br>1. The CrOS share sheet dismisses & destroys itself when it observes the browser window is about to close (or by some other path)<span class="line"><!---->1. The CrOS share sheet dismisses &amp; destroys itself when it observes the browser window is about to close (or by some other path)<!----></span><br>2. The SharingHubBubbleController doesn't know the CrOS share sheet has dismissed itself and tries to close it during a later stage of window teardown<span class="line"><!---->2. The SharingHubBubbleController doesn't know the CrOS share sheet has dismissed itself and tries to close it during a later stage of window teardown<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        by

        Ok - I believe this is a bug in the CrOS sharesheet, not in our code. Specifically, I think the bug is here:<span class="line"><!---->Ok - I believe this is a bug in the CrOS sharesheet, not in our code. Specifically, I think the bug is here:<!----></span><br><br>  void SharesheetBubbleView::CloseWidgetWithReason(<span class="line"><!---->  void SharesheetBubbleView::CloseWidgetWithReason(<!----></span><br>      views::Widget::ClosedReason closed_reason) {<span class="line"><!---->      views::Widget::ClosedReason closed_reason) {<!----></span><br>    View::GetWidget()->CloseWithReason(closed_reason);<span class="line"><!---->    View::GetWidget()-&gt;CloseWithReason(closed_reason);<!----></span><br><br>    // Run |close_callback_| after the widget closes.<span class="line"><!---->    // Run |close_callback_| after the widget closes.<!----></span><br>    if (close_callback_) {<span class="line"><!---->    if (close_callback_) {<!----></span><br>      std::move(close_callback_).Run(closed_reason);<span class="line"><!---->      std::move(close_callback_).Run(closed_reason);<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>    // Bubble is deleted here.<span class="line"><!---->    // Bubble is deleted here.<!----></span><br>    delegate_->OnBubbleClosed(active_target_);<span class="line"><!---->    delegate_-&gt;OnBubbleClosed(active_target_);<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>That's how the `closed_callback_` gets run, but if the ash sharesheet is closed via teardown of the widget tree itself, that code will never be run - instead what will happen is that the ShareSheetBubbleView gets torn down "directly". I think that the best way to fix that is for the destructor of ShareSheetBubbleView to check if close_callback_ is not null and run it if so, to ensure that the client object of ShareSheetBubbleView is always notified.<span class="line"><!---->That's how the `closed_callback_` gets run, but if the ash sharesheet is closed via teardown of the widget tree itself, that code will never be run - instead what will happen is that the ShareSheetBubbleView gets torn down "directly". I think that the best way to fix that is for the destructor of ShareSheetBubbleView to check if close_callback_ is not null and run it if so, to ensure that the client object of ShareSheetBubbleView is always notified.<!----></span><br><br>I'll send a CL to fix it.<span class="line"><!---->I'll send a CL to fix it.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        It sounds like the repro steps in #13 were:<span class="line"><!---->It sounds like the repro steps in #13 were:<!----></span><br><br>1. In window 1, create tabs 1A & 1B<span class="line"><!---->1. In window 1, create tabs 1A &amp; 1B<!----></span><br>2. Open the sharing hub with tab 1B active<span class="line"><!---->2. Open the sharing hub with tab 1B active<!----></span><br>3. Switch to window 2, which causes the sharing hub in window 1 to dismiss<span class="line"><!---->3. Switch to window 2, which causes the sharing hub in window 1 to dismiss<!----></span><br>4. Switch back to window 1 and close tab 1B<span class="line"><!---->4. Switch back to window 1 and close tab 1B<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
